comments:
The Eclipse editor hangs occasionally when selecting text or in the cut/copy
operation of a selected text.

Only way out is to kill eclipse completely.

Eclipse build: 200410300010
JRE 1.5.0

Created an attachment (id=15586)
Window displayed when Eclipse is killed
I have experienced this on two different computers with the same setup.

Does it take long or is there a deadlock? I cannot reproduce. We need more info.
When it "hangs" the next time, please create some VM dumps and attach them. See
also:
http://dev.eclipse.org/viewcvs/index.cgi/%7Echeckout%7E/platform-text-home/development/bug-incomplete.htm

I have now some interesting information from the log that may be related. This
is for 3.1M3:

Could you please provide a test case that leads to this NPE?
Thanks.

Unfortunately it's not easy to re-create the situation where it occured, except
that it occured during the copy operation with "CTRL+C". Using right-click with
the mouse worked. The problem occured in a fairly large file where I had made
some changes to various part of the code with a few sub-prjects involved. Any
attempt to re-create the problem in a simple environment has yet failed. There
were some errors in the code where methods in the KeyStore class was attached to
a variable of the Hashtable class type. (was during a code modification where
the copy/paste operation was intended to resolve those problems.)

Classes involved from the JRE 1.5 environment has been KeyStore, Hashtable and
Properties.
Seems like the bug disappeared with 3.1M3
